title: Contar
text: Counting in English is an essential skill. Let's start with the numbers from one to ten: one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten. Now, let's continue: eleven, twelve, thirteen, fourteen, fifteen, sixteen, seventeen, eighteen, nineteen, twenty. As the pattern continues, the tens are: thirty, forty, fifty, sixty, seventy, eighty, ninety. When counting beyond, it's simple – just combine the tens with the units: twenty-one, thirty-two, forty-five, fifty-six, sixty-seven, seventy-eight, eighty-nine, ninety-nine. For hundreds, add the hundred followed by the tens and units: one hundred, two hundred thirty-four, five hundred sixty-seven. The thousands follow a similar pattern: one thousand, three thousand four hundred fifty-six. And for even larger numbers, use millions, billions, and so on. With practice, counting in English becomes effortless.

title: Se apresentar

I like to swim in the summer. My favorite color is purple. Nice to make a new friend. Hello! My name is Sarah. I am from Brazil. I like to read books and listen to music. I have a cat named Max. title: My Weekend
text: Hi! I'm Lisa. I live in France. On weekends, I like to relax and have fun. On Saturday mornings, I go to a café with my friends. We drink coffee and talk. Then, I visit the park for a walk. In the afternoon, I watch movies or read books. I like comedies and adventure stories. On Sunday, I often cook. Spaghetti is my favorite. In the evening, I call my family. We chat and laugh. Sometimes, I play the guitar. I'm not very good yet, but I practice. Weekends are great!

title: My Hobbies and Favorites
text: Hello! I'm Maria, and I come from Italy. I have a big family – two brothers and one sister. We often gather for Sunday lunches. I enjoy playing the piano. I practice every evening. My favorite music to play is classical. On weekends, I go to the local park to read books. Mystery stories are my favorite. I also like painting landscapes. Watercolors are my choice. I work in a bookstore. I help customers find books. I'm planning a trip to Greece soon. I can't wait to explore the ancient ruins. Thanks for reading my story!

title: A Trip to the Beach
text: Hello! I'm Marco. I live in Spain. Last summer, my family and I went to the beach for a vacation. We had so much fun! We woke up early and packed our bags with towels, sunscreen, and snacks. The drive to the beach was long, but exciting. When we arrived, the sun was shining and the sea looked beautiful. I built sandcastles with my little sister while my parents relaxed on the beach chairs. We swam in the waves and collected seashells. I even saw a crab! For lunch, we had sandwiches and fruit. In the afternoon, we played beach volleyball with other families. The water was cool and refreshing. As the sun set, we made a bonfire and roasted marshmallows. We sang songs and told stories. I'll never forget that day. It was the best beach trip ever

title: Negação: A Rainy Day
text: Hi, I'm Emily. I'm from Canada. Today is a rainy day. I can't go to the park. I can't play outside. I'm inside my house. I can see raindrops on the window. I can hear the rain. I don't like rainy days. I can't wear my new shoes. I can't ride my bike. But I can do other things. I can read books. I can draw pictures. I can watch a movie. Maybe the rain will stop later. Then I can go outside. I hope the sun comes out soon

title: Perguntas: Curious Questions
text: Hello, I'm Alex. Do you know me? No? That's okay. Are you tired? No? Great! Is it a sunny day today? No? Oh, it's raining? Do you like rain? No? Me neither. Did you eat breakfast? No?
